properties.headline: Super Rugby - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Reds at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 7:45pm, full time at 9:45pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade

properties.headline: Sydney Mardi Gras Parade - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Frequent light rail and shuttle buses will run to Moore Park before and after the parade. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Mardi Gras 2022 - Moore Park Transport Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2194_MOORE PARK CENTRAL MARDI GRAS PEDESTRIAN ACCESS MAP_10FEB22_V005.._.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Mardi Gras 2022 - Moore Park Transport Map

properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade returns to the Sydney Cricket Ground this year with more than 40,000 ticketholders expected. The parade starts from 6pm finishing around 10.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Changed traffic conditions will be in effect:

  • Driver Ave will be closed to traffic between Lang Rd and the NRL building at Kippax Lake from 9am Saturday 5 March until 3am Sunday 6 March. Access for drop offs only at the northern end of Driver Ave via Moore Park Rd.
  • The Eastern Distributor Bondi exit to Moore Park Rd will be closed between 10pm and 11.30pm for the safety of spectators leaving the parade. Use the Randwick Anzac Parade exit instead.

Note both Driver Ave grass car parks will be closed for the event. Limited parking will be available at the Entertainment Quarter and Sydney Boys & Girls High School only, arrive early and consider the transport options.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Trials Double Header at Central Coast Stadium. Sea Eagles v Raiders from 6pm and Roosters v Wests Tigers from 8pm. Full-time approx. 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as attendees travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 4pm and will reopen once crowds have cleared after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Midnight Oil concert at Newcastle Entertainment Centre. Doors open from 6pm, support act from 6.45pm, main act from 8pm, finish around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the entertainment centre.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: A Day on The Green - Orange

properties.headline: Concert - ORANGE The Escort Way at Caldwell Lane
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend A Day on the Green - Midnight Oil concert at Heifer Station Wines in Orange. Gates open from 4pm, support acts start from 5.30pm, main act from 8pm and finishing around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual along The Escort Way as fans travel to and from the event.

Speed limit reductions will be in effect along The Escort Way in both directions approaching the site with lane closures also in place. Follow the directions of traffic controllers on site and exercise caution.

properties.headline: Concert - KIAMA Manning Street at Bong Bong Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A sold out crowd is expected to attend the Red Hot Summer Tour concert at Kiama Showgrounds. Gates open from 1pm with acts starting from around 2pm, finishing at 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Manning St and local roads in Kiama approaching the Showground as fans travel to and from the event. Sections of Bong Bong St will be closed to traffic.

Allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads and exercise caution.

properties.headline: Concert - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street at Crown Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Midnight Oil concert at WIN Entertainment Centre, starting from 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual along Harbour St, Burelli St, Corrimal St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads and exercise caution.

properties.headline: Community event - WELLINGTON Mitchell Highway between Showground Road AND Gisborne Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Wellington Vintage Fair & Swap meet events in Wellington on Saturday and Sunday. Traffic is expected to be heavy in the area throughout the weekend. 

A street parade will be held along Percy St from 10am on Saturday. The main event will be held on Sunday at Wellington Showground, gates open from 8am.

The Mitchell Hwy (Maughan St) will be closed between Showground Rd and Gisborne St from 10am to 11am on Saturday.

Light vehicles can detour around the highway via Gisborne St, Percy St, Warne St and Arthur St.

Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Gisborne St, Thornton St and Maxwell St.

Allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads and exercise caution.

properties.headline: Supercars SuperNight - EASTERN CREEK Great Western Highway, M4 Motorway, M7 Motorway, Wallgrove Rd, Ferrers Rd approaching Sydney Motorsport Park
properties.publicTransport: For parking and event shuttle bus information visit transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Supercars SuperNight at Sydney Motorsport Park from Friday 4 to Sunday 6 March. Track activity starts at various times each day.

Motorists should allow extra time on the Great Western Hwy, M4 Mwy, M7 Mwy, Wallgrove Rd, Chandos Rd, Horsley Dr and Ferrers Rd approaching Eastern Creek over the weekend.

Dedicated event parking is available on-site at Sydney Motorsport Park for this event, access via Ferrers Rd from Chandos Rd.

Attendees should allow plenty of additional time for parking and access to the site.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway, M4 Motorway, M7 Motorway, Wallgrove Rd, Ferrers Rd

properties.headline: A-League - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar at Central Coast Stadium. Kick off from 5.05pm, finishing approx. 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 3pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Sydney FC at CommBank Stadium. Women's kick off from 5.05pm, Men's kick off from 7.45pm, full-time approx 9.30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close ahead of full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

webLinks.linkText: Big Husky triathlon 2022 - Road closure maps

properties.headline: Huskisson Triathlon - HUSKISSON Jervis Bay Road approaching Huskisson Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to take part in the Ultimate Husky Triathlon from Friday to Sunday. Local roads will be closed on Friday with major closures in place on the weekend. On-road events start from 6.30am each day, finishing by 5pm on Saturday and 4pm on Sunday. 

Access to Huskisson and Vincentia will be affected on the weekend while roads are closed and the event is underway.

Saturday: 

  • Road closures will be in place between 6.30am and 3pm on sections of Hawke St, Bowen St, Owen St, Sydney St and Tomerong St. Access maintained between 8am-11am.
  • Access to Woollamia Rd from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd will be restricted to residents and businesses only.
  • While Woollamia Rd is closed, access Huskisson via Huskisson Rd and Vincentia via Jervis Bay Rd and Naval College Rd.

Sunday: 

  • Road closures will be in place from 6.30am to 1pm on sections of Huskisson Rd, Woollamia Rd, Hawke St, Owen St, Currambene St, Seasongood Rd, Fairfax Rd, Knoll Pde and Sydney St.
  • Access to Huskisson and Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd/Naval College Rd only due to closures on Huskisson Rd from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd.

Motorists are advised to expect delays and allow extra travel time through the area over the weekend.

properties.headline: NRL Trials - MUDGEE Ullan Road at Lue Road
properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Mudgee CBD and surrounding townships to and from the stadium. Visit the website for more information.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Charity Shield pre-season trials match at Glen Willow Stadium, Mudgee. Gates open from 4pm, NSW Cup game from 4.30pm, NRL: Rabbitohs v Dragons kick off from 7pm fulltime approx 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual through Mudgee and along Ullan Rd, Lue Rd and Church St as crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

No public parking will be permitted at the venue or on Pitts Lane on game day.

properties.headline: Special event - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road and Chatham Road approaching Newcastle Showground
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Newcastle Show at Newcastle Showground in Broadmeadow from 9am to 10pm on Friday and Saturday and from 9am to 5pm on Sunday.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

The right hand turns from Griffiths Rd into the showground will be removed during the event. The westbound left hand turn into the Showground will be permitted for authorised vehicles only.

Across the weekend motorists should allow extra travel time, follow directions from traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Summer Streets on Stanley Street

properties.headline: Summer Streets event - DARLINGHURST Stanley Street between Crown Street, Surry Hills AND Yurong Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Summer Streets - Darlinghurst road closure and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Summer Streets - Darlinghurst road closure and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Summer Streets event on Stanley St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

The following roads will be closed from 9am until 11:30pm: 

  • Stanley St between Crown St and Yurong St 
  • Riley St between Stanely St and Francis Ln
  • Yurong St between Stanley Ln and William St (southbound lanes)
  • Yurong St Between Stanley Ln and Stanley St

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Yurong St, Stanley St and Riley St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

DARLINGHURST

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Riley St Between Stanley St and Francis Ln
  • Stanley St Between Crown St and Yurong St
  • Yurong St* between William St and Stanley Ln (Southbound)
  • Yurong St Between Stanley Ln and Stanley St

Notes: * Resident only access from William Street to Yurong St

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

DARLINGHURST 

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Riley St Between Stanley Ln and Francis Ln
  • Stanley St Between Yurong St and Crown St
  • Yurong St Between Stanley Ln and Stanley St
  • Crown St from Stanley St (western side)
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: NRL - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Trial Match: Panthers v Eels. Pre-game kick-off from 1pm and NRL kick-off from 5pm. Full-time approx. 7pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the game.

Fans should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Special event - PORT MACQUARIE Hastings River Drive at Boundary Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Junior NSW Touch Football State Cup will be taking place at Port Macquarie Regional Stadium from 7am until 7:30pm on Friday and Saturday and from 7am until 4pm on Sunday. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual at the intersection of Hastings Dr and Boundary St as well as surrounding streets between 7am and 7pm daily during the event. The right hand turn from Hastings Dr into Boundary St will also be restricted during the event. 

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time in the area, follow the directions of traffic controllers onsite and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
